====== What is a template and how to apply a layout? ======

<blockquote align="text-center center" width="fit-content" >
**Layouts are important.**

{{:strap:layout_funny.png?300|}}
</blockquote>


===== About =====




ComboStrap supports the following layouts

^ Layout ^ Description ^
| [[holy]] | The holy-grail layout |
| [[#median]] | A layout that improves readability by constraining and centering the content |
| [[#landing]] | A layout to create a landing page for the [[docs:page:system:home|home page]] |
| [[#index]] | A layout to create a semi-landing page for the [[docs:page:system:index|index pages]] |
| [[#hamburger]] | The default layout of admin pages (without sides)|


===== List =====



==== Median ====

The median is a layout that emphasizes readability by:
  * centering the main content
  * with a fix width (making the length of a line shorter).

It's the default layout for all root pages (ie pages without [[docs:page:system:namespace|namespace]])

The page side is not shown.







==== Landing ====

The landing layout is the default layout of the [[docs:page:system:home|home page]].

In a landing page layout:
  * the main content is not [[docs:theme:slot:container|contained]]
  * the page header, the page footer, the main content are shown
  * the sides page and main, the main header and footer, the [[:docs:navigation:toc|toc]] are not shown

To know more about landing page, see the dedicated page: [[..:slot:landing]]


==== Hamburger ====

The hamburger is the default layout for any admin page.

A hamburger will show only three layers:
  * the page header
  * the main (header, content and footer)
  * the page footer

There is no page side.


==== Index ====

An ''index'' is a landing page for a [[docs:page:system:namespace|namespace]].

It shows:
  * the page header and footer
  * the main content
  * the page side

It does not show:
  * the [[:docs:navigation:toc|table of content]]
  * the main header and footer
  * the sidekick
===== How to set the page layout ? =====

You can set the page layout via the [[docs:metadata:manager|metadata manager]].
